alert.note: Alert for Escambia Coastal; Okaloosa Coastal; Santa Rosa Coastal (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 7:21AM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Okaloosa, southern Santa Rosa and south central Escambia Counties through 745 AM CDT... At 621 AM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles west of Warrington to 14 miles southeast of Pensacola Beach to 16 miles south of Navarre Beach. Movement was north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pensacola, Ferry Pass, Brent, West Pensacola, Ensley, Pace, Gulf Breeze, Goulding, Myrtle Grove, Oriole Beach, Navarre, Pea Ridge and Floridatown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CDT for northwestern Florida.

area.areaDesc: Escambia Coastal; Okaloosa Coastal; Santa Rosa Coastal
